Articles.Content:
Is there a point to doing things faster (in less years) in career mode? For interplanetary missions you cannot really work around waiting for transfer windows so that is a big time sink. Careful advance planning for all missions could help, but gives me headaches, and I want to know if it the game cares how much time you use. Of course I may treat it as a challenge - colonize the whole system in X years - but not interested at the moment.

Thanks!

Time has almost no real bearing on the game other than for transfer windows and time to travel somewhere.  Not that I've found, anyhow.  I know some people want to conserve as much time as possible, but I think that's just a personal thing.
you lose a bit of reputation over time, so if you stay idle 20 years your reputation will sink. other than that, i know of no other ill effect

Contacts require completion by a certain deadline.  So just be aware of that and not let the time expire without completion or you'll take a hit in lost funds and reputation.
